pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:5.1: 16. The training rule on sitting down without asking for permission
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:6.2: At that time the nun Thullanandā visited families after the meal, and she sat down and lay down on seats without asking the lay people for permission.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:6.3: Feeling shy because of Thullanandā, people there neither sat down nor lay down.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:6.4: They then complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:6.5: “How can Venerable Thullanandā visit families after the meal, and then sit down and lie down on seats without asking the lay people for permission?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:7.1: The nuns heard the complaints of those people.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:7.2: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:7.3: “How can Venerable Thullanandā visit families after the meal, and then sit down and lie down on seats without asking the lay people for permission?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:7.4: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:7.7: How can the nun Thullanandā visit families after the meal, and then sit down and lie down on seats without asking the lay people for permission?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:7.8: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:7.9: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:8.1: ‘If a nun visits families after the meal, and then sits down or lies down on a seat without asking the lay people for permission, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:9.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:10.2: when the middle of the day has passed, until sunset.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:11.2: there are four kinds of families: aristocratic families, brahmin families, merchant families, worker families.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:12.1: Without asking the lay people for permission:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:12.2: not having asked permission from a person in that family who has the authority to approve it.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:13.2: a place for sitting cross-legged is what is meant.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:14.2: if she sits down on that seat, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:15.2: if she lies down on that seat, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:16.1: If she has not asked for permission, and she does not perceive that she has, and she sits down or lies down on a seat, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:16.2: If she has not asked for permission, but she is unsure of it, and she sits down or lies down on a seat, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:16.3: If she has not asked for permission, but she perceives that she has, and she sits down or lies down on a seat, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:17.1: If it is not a place for sitting cross-legged, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:17.2: If she has asked for permission, but she does not perceive that she has, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:17.3: If she has asked for permission, but she is unsure if she has, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:17.4: If she has asked for permission, and she perceives that she has, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:18.2: if she sits down or lies down after asking for permission;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:18.3: if the seat is permanently meant for her;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc16:18.7: if she is the first offender.
